intro: Chamaefilix, commonly known as the rock rose, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Cupressaceae. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs, characterized by their aromatic foliage and showy flowers. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Chamaefilix species are known for their resilience to harsh environmental conditions, including drought and poor soil. Their flowers, which can range from white to pink or red, are often arranged in clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
